events.name: Enabling Smart Buildings with IoT, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
events.description: Why should a facility manager care about the “Internet of Things” when virtually all existing buildings operate just fine when not connected to any external network? Are IoT and “Smart Buildings” marketing hype or can they actually provide value to building owners and operators? IoT growth predictions tend to show buildings as a key component to the predicted exponential growth of connected devices. In this session we will learn from a building industry veteran’s perspective on how IoT, AI, ML will enable Smarter Buildings and hence the Smarter Cities. ******************************************************************************** Win 3X 1 Full Day Summit Pass of #ConnecTechAsia2018 worth S$850 each. Plese rememebr to bring along your business cards for the luckdraw. ******************************************************************************** AGENDA: • 18:00 - 18:45- Registration, Networking & Snacks (Sponsored by #ConnecTechAsia2018 • 18:45 - 19:00- IoTSG Introduction, Building4.0 by Salim • 19:00 - 19:20-IoT applications to develop sustainable green buildings by Benjamin • 19:20 - 19:40- Realising connected Urban Development, Smart Buildings with AI & ML by Leonard • 19:40 - 20:00- Applications of IoT in Built Environment, Utilities, Sustainability by Dr Sekhar • 20:00 - 20:30- Panel Discussion & QnA, • 20:30 - 21:00- Networking Continued & Luck Draw! SPEAKERS: • Benjamin Towell, Senior Manager, Green Mark Department, Building & Construction Authority • Leonard Jayamohan, Director - Social Innovation, Digital Transformation, Hitachi Consulting • Sekhar Kondepudi Asociate Professor Smart Buildings and Smart Cities National University of Singapore  VENUE: NUS Enterprise, #02-01, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent  Join IoTSG Join IoTSG Validated network, fill in your details. *****************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography may be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organizations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: First Code Academy Summer Camps Info Session 2018
events.description:
Learn to think by learning to code.
Know more about First Code Academy's pedagogy and comprehensive roadmap designed for students as young as 4 years old.
Come join us for an Info Session! Learn more about the course content, hear from the instructors, and discover what it means for your child to learn at First Code Academy.Please feel free to let us know if you have any questions in the meantime. Contact us: hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com | 6820 2633 


Shaping Future Creators
First Code Academy is a leading education institute that teaches kids coding courses and develop curriculum for K-12 students to learn not just coding skills, but computational thinking. Our goal is to empower children and teenagers to become creative leaders in the digital era, for their future career and for driving social change.
events.location: First Code Academy, 04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: Android, iOS and Web testing in a single framework & Image-based testing
events.description: Hello Friends, Martin Schneider from Carousell will be sharing his experience in image based testing with appium and the best practices to apply polymorphism while designing the test framework. Agenda 6:00pm - Networking and food 6.30pm - Android, iOS and Web testing in a single framework 7.30pm - Image-based testing with Appium and Sikuli 8:15pm - Q & A 9:00pm - End
events.location: Carousell HQ, 240 Tanjong Pagar Rd, Singapore 088540

events.name: Let's chat with SUSI.AI - An In-House Personal Assistant Framework
events.description: SUSI.AI is an intelligent Open Source personal assistant - an alternative to Alexa, Google Home and Siri for companies. It is capable of chat and voice interaction by using APIs to perform actions such as music playback, making to-do lists, setting alarms, streaming podcasts, playing audiobooks, and providing weather, traffic, and other real time information. Additional functionalities can be added as console services using external APIs. Susi AI is able to answer questions and depending on the context will ask for additional information in order to perform the desired outcome. The core of the assistant is the Susi AI server that holds the "intelligence" and "personality" of Susi AI. The Android and web applications make use of the APIs to access information from a hosted server. Development: https://github.com/fossasia/susi_server Demo: https://susi.ai * Speaker: Mario Behling Short bio: Mario Behling is the co-founder of SUSI AI, the Open Source Personal Assistant. Mario is a German born technologist with 15 years of experience in software development and startups. He co-started FOSSASIA which develops solutions like Open Event, the Open Source event management system, Pocket Science Lab and the Meilix Linux generator. He also helped to get the lubuntu community started, ran IT development companies, designed and build a seven storey eco-hotel in Vietnam and, setup mesh networks in Afghan schools. Photo by Franck Veschi on Unsplash
events.location: VISA Singapore, 10 Eunos Road 8, #08-01  (South Lobby), Singapore Post Centre

events.name: Master of Science in Technopreneurship & Innovation (Information Session)
events.description:
MSc TIP Infosession (12th April 2018, Thursday) Agenda
6:30pm: Registration7:00pm: Talk - Entrepreneurial Leadership in Industry 4.0 by Associate Professor Tan Joo Seng (NTU)7:45pm: Introduction to MSc TIP and sharing by Alumni
Synopsis
Industry 4.0 will need more entrepreneurial leaders. Leaders who are more enterprising, curious, agile and capable of adapting to constant change. We call this leadership capability "surfing on the edge". Entrepreneurial leaders who can see and seize opportunities unleashed by disruptive innovations and digital transformations at the intersection of the physical, digital and biological. Entrepreneurial leaders also possess ambidexterity as they are able to explore new business models as well as exploit existing ones. Entrepreneurial leaders will be tomorrow's game changers even as the political, economic, social and ecological contexts across the world experience profound changes in Industry 4.0.


* NTC reserves the rights to make changes according to circumstances
events.location: Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, 320 Orchard Road, Level 2 Ketumbar Room, Singapore 238865
events.group_name: Nanyang Technopreneurship Center (NTC), Nanyang Technological University

events.name: Visual Studio Tools for AI and UI
events.description: In this meetup, we are proud to have Cheah Eng Soon, the Windows Development, Visual Studio and Development Technologies MVP, to join us to talk about how Visual Studio tools can help developers in their AI projects. Meanwhile, I will also be sharing about Avalonia, a multi-platform .NET UI framework inspired by WPF. AGENDA: SESSION 1: Visual Studio Tools for AI - Eng SoonVisual Studio Tools for AI enables developers and data scientists the most robust set of integrated tooling for creating, debugging, and deploying their custom deep learning models. Using the power of Visual Studio you can seamlessly build an app using the model you just trained without switching IDEs. SESSION 2: Avalonia .NET Core Application - Chun LinAvalonia (http://avaloniaui.net/) is a WPF-inspired cross-platform XAML-based UI framework providing a flexible styling system and supporting Windows, Linux, and OSX. I'm currently still playing around with it. So if you have some thoughts or you have tried about it before, please join the discussion to share with us too! Finally, do join this meetup and and also invite your friends to join this meetup. Many thanks for your support and help. Your friendly co-organizer,Chun Lin ============================ FOOD On a happier note, Microsoft would be sponsoring food for this meetup, so we need RSVP. ============================ IMPORTANT TO KNOW: YOUR PHOTO ID! Kindly remember to bring your photo ID (NRIC, EP or Work Permit, Student Pass, Passport) to get through NTUC Centre Building security at Level 1.
